nodes.text: The Cirra Mace was a ceremonial weapon that was very important to the Cirra akia, the most warlike clan of the Aramandi people in the Brak sector.

The Cirra Mace was 80 centimeters long, made of black obsidian. It was adorned with emeralds and rubies. It was not said to have any strange powers or curses, but was central to Cirra religious ceremonies.

The mace was stolen in about 9 BBY by heretics and sold to an unknown party outside the Aramand Cluster. It turned up fifteen years later on the black market in Brenn, but the Cirra were unable to recover it. It was rumored to have ended up in the Nalroni city of Celanon.
